00070 const char* default_name( bool free_only )
00071 {
00072   static const char all_name[] = "QualityAssessor";
00073   static const char free_name[] = "QualityAssessor(free only)";
00074   return free_only ? free_name : all_name;
00075 }
00076 
00077 QualityAssessor::QualityAssessor( bool print_summary,
00078                                   bool free_only,
00079                                   const char* inverted_tag_name,
00080                                   std::string name) :
00081   myData(new Data),
00082   qualityAssessorName(name),
00083   outputStream( std::cout ),
00084   printSummary( print_summary ),
00085   skipFixedSamples(free_only)
00086 {
00087   if (inverted_tag_name)
00088     tag_inverted_elements( inverted_tag_name );
00089     
00090   if (qualityAssessorName.empty()) 
00091     qualityAssessorName = default_name( free_only );
00092 
00093   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00094     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = 0;
00095 }

00169 QualityAssessor::QualityAssessor( const QualityAssessor& copy ) :
00170   myData(copy.myData),
00171   qualityAssessorName(copy.qualityAssessorName),
00172   assessList(copy.assessList),
00173   outputStream(copy.outputStream),
00174   printSummary(copy.printSummary),
00175   invertedTagName(copy.invertedTagName),
00176   fixedTagName(copy.fixedTagName),
00177   skipFixedSamples(copy.skipFixedSamples)
00178 
00179 {
00180   list_type::iterator iter;
00181   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) 
00182     (*iter)->referenceCount++;
00183   myData->referenceCount++;
00184 
00185  for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00186    elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = copy.elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON];
00187 }
00188 
00189 QualityAssessor& QualityAssessor::operator=( const QualityAssessor& copy )
00190 {
00191   list_type::iterator iter;
00192   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00193     Assessor* assessor = *iter;
00194     if (0 == --assessor->referenceCount)
00195       delete assessor;
00196   }
00197 
00198   myData = copy.myData;
00199   qualityAssessorName = copy.qualityAssessorName;
00200   assessList = copy.assessList;
00201   printSummary = copy.printSummary;
00202   invertedTagName = copy.invertedTagName;
00203   fixedTagName = copy.fixedTagName;
00204   skipFixedSamples = copy.skipFixedSamples;
00205   
00206   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) 
00207     (*iter)->referenceCount++;
00208   myData->referenceCount++;
00209 
00210   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00211     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = copy.elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON];
00212     
00213   return *this;
00214 }  
00215 
00216 QualityAssessor::~QualityAssessor()
00217 {
00218   list_type::iterator iter;
00219   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00220     Assessor* assessor = *iter;
00221     if (0 == --assessor->referenceCount)
00222       delete assessor;
00223   }
00224   if (0 == --myData->referenceCount)
00225     delete myData;
00226 }
00227  
00228 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_average() const
00229 {
00230   return count ? sum/count : 0;
00231 }
00232 
00233 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_rms() const 
00234 {
00235   return count ? sqrt(sqrSum/count) : 0;
00236 }
00237 
00238 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_stddev() const
00239 {
00240   double sqr = count ? sqrSum/count - sum*sum/((double)count*count) : 0;
00241   return sqr < 0 ? 0 : sqrt(sqr);
00242 }
00243 
00244 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_power_mean() const
00245 {
00246   return (count && pMean) ? pow(pSum/count, 1/pMean) : 0;
00247 }
00248 
00249 bool QualityAssessor::get_inverted_element_count(int &inverted_elems,
00250                                                  int &inverted_samples,
00251                                                  MsqError &err)
00252 {
00253   if(myData->invertedElementCount == -1){
00254     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Number of inverted elements has not yet been calculated.", MsqError::INVALID_STATE);
00255     return false;
00256   }
00257   inverted_elems = myData->invertedElementCount;
00258   inverted_samples = myData->invertedSampleCount;
00259   return true;
00260 }

00263 
00264 void QualityAssessor::add_quality_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00265                                               int histogram_intervals,
00266                                               double power_mean,
00267                                               const char* tag_name,
00268                                               const char* label )
00269 { 
00270   list_type::iterator i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00271   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00272   if (histogram_intervals > 0)
00273     (*i)->histogram.resize( histogram_intervals+2 );
00274   else
00275     (*i)->histogram.clear();
00276   (*i)->haveHistRange = false;
00277   if (!tag_name)
00278     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00279   else
00280     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00281 }
00282 
00283 QualityAssessor::list_type::iterator QualityAssessor::find_or_add( 
00284                                                 QualityMetric* qm,
00285                                                 const char* label )
00286 {
00287   list_type::iterator iter;
00288   
00289     // If metric is already in list, find it
00290   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00291     if ((*iter)->qualMetric == qm )
00292       break;
00293   
00294     // If metric not found in list, add it
00295   if (iter == assessList.end())
00296   {
00297     Assessor* new_assessor = new Assessor(qm, label);
00298     new_assessor->referenceCount = 1;
00299     if (qm->get_metric_type() == QualityMetric::VERTEX_BASED)
00300     {
00301       assessList.push_back( new_assessor );
00302       iter = --assessList.end();
00303     }
00304     else
00305     {
00306       assessList.push_front( new_assessor );
00307       iter = assessList.begin();
00308     }
00309   }
00310   
00311   return iter;
00312 }
00313 
00314 QualityAssessor::list_type::iterator QualityAssessor::find_stopping_assessment()
00315 {
00316   list_type::iterator iter;
00317   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00318     if ((*iter)->stopping_function())
00319       break;
00320   return iter;
00321 }
00322 
00323 
00333 void QualityAssessor::set_stopping_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00334                                                int histogram_intervals,
00335                                                double power_mean,
00336                                                const char* tag_name,
00337                                                const char* label )
00338 {
00339   list_type::iterator i = find_stopping_assessment();
00340   if (i != assessList.end())
00341     (*i)->set_stopping_function(false);
00342 
00343   i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00344   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00345   if (histogram_intervals > 0)
00346     (*i)->histogram.resize( histogram_intervals+2 );
00347   else
00348     (*i)->histogram.clear();
00349   (*i)->haveHistRange = false;
00350   if (!tag_name)
00351     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00352   else
00353     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00354   (*i)->set_stopping_function(true);
00355 }
00356 
00357 
00368 void QualityAssessor::add_histogram_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00369                                                 double min_val, 
00370                                                 double max_val,
00371                                                 int intervals,
00372                                                 double power_mean,
00373                                                 const char* tag_name,
00374                                                 const char* label )
00375 {
00376   if (intervals < 1)
00377     intervals = 1;
00378   list_type::iterator i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00379   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00380   (*i)->histMin = min_val;
00381   (*i)->histMax = max_val;
00382   (*i)->haveHistRange = min_val < max_val;
00383   (*i)->histogram.resize( intervals + 2 );
00384   if (!tag_name)
00385     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00386   else
00387     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00388 }

00390 
00391 TagHandle QualityAssessor::get_tag( Mesh* mesh,
00392                                     std::string name, 
00393                                     Mesh::TagType type, 
00394                                     unsigned size, 
00395                                     MsqError& err )
00396 {
00397   TagHandle tag  = mesh->tag_get( name, err );
00398   if (!err) {
00399     Mesh::TagType exist_type;
00400     std::string junk;
00401     unsigned exist_size;
00402     mesh->tag_properties( tag, junk, exist_type, exist_size, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00403     if (type != exist_type || size != exist_size) {
00404        MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError:: TAG_ALREADY_EXISTS,
00405        "Tag \"%s\" exists with incorrect type or length.",
00406        name.c_str());
00407     }
00408   }
00409   else if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00410     err.clear();
00411     tag = mesh->tag_create( name, type, size, 0, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00412   }
00413   else {
00414     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00415   }
00416   
00417   return tag;
00418 }

00420 void QualityAssessor::initialize_queue( MeshDomainAssoc* mesh_and_domain,
00421                                         const Settings* settings,
00422                                         MsqError& err )
00423 {
00424   for (list_type::iterator i = assessList.begin(); i != assessList.end(); ++i) {
00425     (*i)->get_metric()->initialize_queue( mesh_and_domain, settings, err );
00426     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00427   }
00428 }

00441 double QualityAssessor::loop_over_mesh( MeshDomainAssoc* mesh_and_domain,
00442                                         const Settings* settings,
00443                                         MsqError& err)
00444 {
00445   return loop_over_mesh_internal( mesh_and_domain, settings, NULL, err );
00446 }
00447 
00459 double QualityAssessor::loop_over_mesh( ParallelMesh* mesh,
00460                                         MeshDomain* domain,
00461                                         const Settings* settings,
00462                                         MsqError& err)
00463 {
00464   MeshDomainAssoc mesh_and_domain = MeshDomainAssoc((Mesh*)mesh, domain, false, true);
00465   return loop_over_mesh_internal( &mesh_and_domain, settings, 
00466                                   mesh->get_parallel_helper(), err );
00467 }
00468 
00469 double QualityAssessor::loop_over_mesh_internal( MeshDomainAssoc* mesh_and_domain,
00470                                                  const Settings* settings,
00471                                                  ParallelHelper* helper,
00472                                                  MsqError& err )
00473 {
00474     // Clear out any previous data
00475   reset_data();
00476 
00477     // Clear culling flag, set hard fixed flag, etc on all vertices
00478   initialize_vertex_byte( mesh_and_domain, settings, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00479 
00480   Mesh* mesh = mesh_and_domain->get_mesh();
00481   MeshDomain* domain = mesh_and_domain->get_domain();
00482   invalid_values = false;
00483 
00484   PatchData patch;
00485   patch.set_mesh( mesh );
00486   patch.set_domain( domain );
00487   if (settings)
00488     patch.attach_settings( settings );
00489   
00490   ElementPatches elem_patches;
00491   elem_patches.set_mesh( mesh );
00492   VertexPatches vert_patches(1,false);
00493   vert_patches.set_mesh( mesh );
00494   
00495   std::vector<PatchSet::PatchHandle> patches;
00496   std::vector<PatchSet::PatchHandle>::iterator p;
00497   std::vector<Mesh::VertexHandle> patch_verts;
00498   std::vector<Mesh::ElementHandle> patch_elems;
00499   std::vector<size_t> metric_handles;
00500 
00501     // Check if we really need the helper
00502   if (helper && helper->get_nprocs() == 1) helper = 0;
00503 
00504     // Get any necessary tag handles.
00505   TagHandle invertedTag = 0;
00506   if (tagging_inverted_elements()) {
00507     invertedTag = get_tag( mesh, invertedTagName, Mesh::INT, 1, err );
00508     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00509   }
00510   list_type::iterator iter;
00511   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00512     if ((*iter)->write_to_tag()) {
00513       (*iter)->tagHandle = get_tag( mesh, (*iter)->tagName, Mesh::DOUBLE, 1, err );
00514       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00515     }
00516   }
00517   
00518   TagHandle fixedTag = 0;
00519   if (tagging_fixed_elements()) {
00520     fixedTag = get_tag( mesh, fixedTagName, Mesh::INT, 1, err );
00521     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00522   }
00523 
00524   // Record the type of metric for each assessment so that it can be
00525   // included in the QualitySummary report. 
00526   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) 
00527   {
00528     ElementAvgQM* avg_ptr = dynamic_cast<ElementAvgQM*>((*iter)->get_metric());
00529     ElementMaxQM* max_ptr = dynamic_cast<ElementMaxQM*>((*iter)->get_metric());
00530     TMPQualityMetric* tq_ptr = dynamic_cast<TMPQualityMetric*>( (*iter)->get_metric() );
00531     if (avg_ptr)
00532       (*iter)->assessScheme = ELEMENT_AVG_QM;
00533     else if (max_ptr)
00534      (*iter)->assessScheme = ELEMENT_MAX_QM;
00535     else if (tq_ptr)
00536       (*iter)->assessScheme = TMP_QUALITY_METRIC;
00537     else
00538       (*iter)->assessScheme = QUALITY_METRIC;
00539   }
00540 
00541     // Check for any metrics for which a histogram is to be 
00542     // calculated and for which the user has not specified 
00543     // minimum and maximum values.  
00544     // Element-based metrics are first in list, followed
00545     // by vertex-based metrics.  Find first vertex-based
00546     // metric also such that element metrics go from
00547     // assessList.begin() to elem_end and vertex metrics
00548     // go from elem_end to assessList.end()
00549   list_type::iterator elem_end = assessList.end();
00550   bool need_second_pass_for_elements = false;
00551   bool need_second_pass_for_vertices = false;
00552   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00553   {
00554     if ((*iter)->get_metric()->get_metric_type() == QualityMetric::VERTEX_BASED)
00555       break;
00556 
00557     if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00558       need_second_pass_for_elements = true;
00559   }
00560   elem_end = iter;
00561   for ( ; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00562   {
00563     if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00564       need_second_pass_for_vertices = true;
00565   }
00566   
00567     // Do element-based metrics
00568   elem_patches.get_patch_handles( patches, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00569 
00570   myData->invertedElementCount = myData->invertedSampleCount = myData->sampleCount = 0;
00571   myData->elementCount = patches.size();
00572   myData->freeElementCount = 0;
00573   
00574   int inverted, samples;
00575   bool first_pass = false;
00576   do { // might need to loop twice to calculate histograms
00577     first_pass = !first_pass;
00578 
00579       //until there are no more patches
00580       //there is another get_next_patch at
00581       //the end of this loop
00582     for (p = patches.begin(); p != patches.end(); ++p) {
00583       elem_patches.get_patch( *p, patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00584 
00585       if (helper) {
00586         bool ours = helper->is_our_element( patch_elems[0], err );
00587         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00588         if (!ours) {
00589           --myData->elementCount;
00590           continue;
00591         }
00592       }
00593       patch.set_mesh_entities( patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00594       
00595       if (first_pass)
00596       {
00597           // record element type for use in print_summary
00598         for (size_t i=0; i < patch.num_elements(); i++)
00599         {
00600           const MsqMeshEntity* elem = &patch.element_by_index(i);
00601           EntityTopology topo = elem->get_element_type();  
00602           elementTypeCount[topo - POLYGON]++;
00603         }
00604       }
00605 
00606       if (0 == patch.num_free_vertices()) {
00607         if (tagging_fixed_elements()) {
00608           Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00609           int val = 1;
00610           mesh->tag_set_element_data( fixedTag, 1, &h, &val, err );
00611           MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00612         }
00613         if (skipFixedSamples)
00614           continue;
00615       }
00616       
00617        //first check for inverted elements
00618       if (first_pass){
00619         ++myData->freeElementCount;
00620         inverted = samples = 0;
00621         patch.element_by_index(0).check_element_orientation(patch, inverted, samples, err);
00622         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00623         myData->invertedElementCount += (inverted != 0);
00624         myData->invertedSampleCount += inverted;
00625         myData->sampleCount += samples;
00626 
00627         if (tagging_inverted_elements()) {
00628           Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00629           int val = (inverted != 0);
00630           mesh->tag_set_element_data( invertedTag, 1, &h, &val, err );
00631           MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00632         }
00633       }
00634 
00635       // now process all element-based metrics
00636       for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != elem_end; ++iter)
00637       {
00638           // If first pass, get values for all metrics
00639         if (first_pass)
00640         {
00641           double value = 0.0;
00642           metric_handles.clear();
00643           QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00644           qm->get_single_pass( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00645           for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00646                j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00647           {
00648             bool valid = (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); // MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00649             if (err.error_code() == err.BARRIER_VIOLATED)
00650             {
00651               err.clear();
00652               invalid_values = true;
00653             }
00654             (*iter)->add_value(value);
00655             if (!valid) 
00656               (*iter)->add_invalid_value();
00657           }
00658             // we don't do tag stuff unless metric is truely element-based
00659             // (only one value per element)
00660           if ((*iter)->write_to_tag() && metric_handles.size() == 1) {
00661             Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00662             mesh->tag_set_element_data( (*iter)->tagHandle, 1, &h, &value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00663           }
00664         }
00665           // If second pass, only do metrics for which the
00666           // histogram hasn't been calculated yet.
00667         else if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00668         {
00669           metric_handles.clear();
00670           QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00671           qm->get_evaluations( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00672           for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00673                j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00674           {
00675             double value;
00676             (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00677             (*iter)->add_hist_value(value);
00678           }
00679         }
00680       }
00681     }
00682     if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0.0;
00683 
00684       // Fix up any histogram ranges which were calculated
00685     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != elem_end; ++iter)
00686       if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00687         if (first_pass) {
00688           if (helper) {
00689             helper->communicate_min_max_to_all(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err); 
00690             MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00691           }
00692         
00693           (*iter)->calculate_histogram_range();
00694 // Uncomment the following to have the QA keep the first
00695 // calculated histogram range for all subsequent iterations.
00696 //          else
00697 //            (*iter)->haveHistRange = true;
00698         }
00699   } while (first_pass && need_second_pass_for_elements && !invalid_values);
00700       
00701     
00702       // Do vertex-based metrics
00703   if (assessList.end() != elem_end)
00704   {
00705     vert_patches.get_patch_handles( patches, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00706     
00707     bool first_pass = false;
00708     do { // might need to loop twice to calculate histograms
00709       first_pass = !first_pass;
00710      
00711         //until there are no more patches
00712         //there is another get_next_patch at
00713         //the end of this loop
00714       for (p = patches.begin(); p != patches.end(); ++p) {
00715         vert_patches.get_patch( *p, patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00716         patch.set_mesh_entities( patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00717         if (skipFixedSamples && 0 == patch.num_free_vertices())
00718           continue;
00719         
00720         Mesh::VertexHandle vert_handle = reinterpret_cast<Mesh::VertexHandle>(*p);
00721 
00722         for (iter = elem_end; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00723         {
00724             // If first pass, get values for all metrics
00725           if (first_pass)
00726           {
00727             double value = 0.0;
00728             metric_handles.clear();
00729             QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00730             qm->get_single_pass( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00731             for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00732                  j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00733             {
00734               bool valid = (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00735               (*iter)->add_value(value);
00736               if (!valid) 
00737                 (*iter)->add_invalid_value();
00738             }
00739               // we don't do tag stuff unless metric is truely vertex-based
00740               // (only one value per vertex)
00741             if ((*iter)->write_to_tag() && metric_handles.size() == 1) {
00742               mesh->tag_set_vertex_data( (*iter)->tagHandle, 1, &vert_handle, &value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00743             }
00744           }
00745             // If second pass, only do metrics for which the
00746             // histogram hasn't been calculated yet.
00747           else if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00748           {
00749             metric_handles.clear();
00750             QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00751             qm->get_evaluations( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00752             for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00753                  j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00754             {
00755               double value;
00756               (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00757               (*iter)->add_hist_value(value);
00758             }
00759           }
00760         }
00761       }
00762       if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0.0;
00763   
00764         // Fix up any histogram ranges which were calculated
00765       for (iter = elem_end; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00766         if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00767           if (first_pass) {
00768             if (helper) {
00769               helper->communicate_min_max_to_all(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err); 
00770               MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00771             }
00772             (*iter)->calculate_histogram_range();
00773 // Uncomment the following to have the QA keep the first
00774 // calculated histogram range for all subsequent iterations.
00775 //          else
00776 //            (*iter)->haveHistRange = true;
00777           }
00778     } while (first_pass && need_second_pass_for_vertices && !invalid_values);
00779   }  
00780   
00781   if (helper) {
00782     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00783 
00784       helper->communicate_min_max_to_zero(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err);
00785       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00786 
00787       helper->communicate_sums_to_zero(&myData->freeElementCount, &myData->invertedElementCount, &myData->elementCount, &myData->invertedSampleCount, &myData->sampleCount, &((*iter)->count), &((*iter)->numInvalid), &((*iter)->sum), &((*iter)->sqrSum), err);
00788       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00789 
00790       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean()) {
00791         helper->communicate_power_sum_to_zero( &((*iter)->pMean), err );
00792         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00793       }
00794 
00795       if ((*iter)->have_histogram()) {
00796         helper->communicate_histogram_to_zero((*iter)->histogram, err);
00797         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00798       }
00799     }
00800   }
00801   
00802     // Print results, if requested
00803   if (printSummary && (!helper || helper->get_rank() == 0))
00804     print_summary( this->outputStream );
00805   
00806   list_type::iterator i = find_stopping_assessment();
00807   return i == assessList.end() ? 0 : (*i)->stopping_function_value();
00808 }
00809 
00810 bool QualityAssessor::invalid_elements( ) const
00811 {
00812   bool result = false;
00813   list_type::const_iterator iter;
00814   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00815     if ((*iter)->get_invalid_element_count())
00816       result = true;
00817   return result;
00818 }
00819 
00820 void QualityAssessor::reset_data() 
00821 {
00822   list_type::iterator iter;
00823   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00824     (*iter)->reset_data();
00825   myData->invertedElementCount = -1;
00826   myData->invertedSampleCount = -1;
00827 
00828   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00829     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = 0;
00830 }
00831 
00832 void QualityAssessor::scale_histograms(QualityAssessor* optimized)
00833 {
00834     // find the histograms to scale
00835   list_type::iterator iter;
00836   list_type::iterator initial;
00837   list_type::iterator optimal;
00838   bool initial_found = false, optimal_found = false;
00839   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00840   {
00841     if ((*iter)->histogram.size() > 0)
00842     {
00843       if (initial_found == false)
00844       {
00845         initial = iter;
00846         initial_found = true;
00847         break;
00848       }
00849     }
00850   }
00851   for (iter = optimized->assessList.begin(); iter != optimized->assessList.end(); ++iter)
00852   {
00853     if ((*iter)->histogram.size() > 0)
00854     {
00855       optimal = iter;
00856       optimal_found = true;
00857       break;
00858     }
00859   }
00860   if (!initial_found || !optimal_found)
00861   {
00862       // issue warning: orig histograms not found
00863     if (!initial_found)
00864       outputStream << "WARNING: 'before' histogram not found" << std::endl;
00865     else
00866       outputStream << "WARNING: 'after' histogram not found" << std::endl;
00867     return;
00868   }
00869 
00870     // check number of intervals (bins) for each histogram
00871   int num_intervals = (*initial)->histogram.size()-2;
00872   if (num_intervals != int((*optimal)->histogram.size()-2))
00873   {
00874        // issue warning: number of intervals not the same   
00875     outputStream << "WARNING: histogram intervals are not the same" << std::endl;
00876     return;
00877   }
00878 
00879     // calculate new max and min values
00880   double combined_min, combined_max;  
00881   if ((*initial)->histMin < (*optimal)->histMin)
00882     combined_min = (*initial)->histMin;
00883   else
00884     combined_min = (*optimal)->histMin;
00885 
00886   if ((*initial)->histMax > (*optimal)->histMax)
00887     combined_max = (*initial)->histMax;
00888   else
00889     combined_max = (*optimal)->histMax;
00890 
00891     // put the before quality values into the correct new bins
00892 
00893     // First and last values in array are counts of valuesnum_intervals+1
00894     // outside the user-specified range of the histogram
00895     // (below and above, respectively.)
00896   std::vector<int> new_initial_histogram;    
00897   new_initial_histogram.resize((*initial)->histogram.size(), 0);
00898   new_initial_histogram[0] = (*initial)->histogram[0];
00899   new_initial_histogram[new_initial_histogram.size()-1] = 
00900                   (*initial)->histogram[(*initial)->histogram.size()-1];
00901   
00902     // Re-calculate which interval the value is in.  Add one
00903     // because first entry is for values below user-specifed
00904     // minimum value for histogram.
00905   double combined_range = combined_max - combined_min;
00906   double initial_min = (*initial)->histMin;
00907   double optimal_min = (*optimal)->histMin;
00908   double initial_range = (*initial)->histMax - (*initial)->histMin;
00909   double optimal_range = (*optimal)->histMax - (*optimal)->histMin;
00910   double combined_step = combined_range / num_intervals;
00911   double initial_step = initial_range / num_intervals;
00912   double optimal_step = optimal_range / num_intervals;
00913     // round steps to 3 significant digits
00914   if (combined_step >= 0.001)
00915     combined_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(combined_step);
00916   if (initial_step >= 0.001)
00917     initial_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(initial_step);
00918   if (optimal_step >= 0.001)
00919     optimal_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(optimal_step);
00920 
00921     // populate initial histogram
00922   if (initial_range == combined_range)
00923   {
00924       // just copy histogram
00925     new_initial_histogram = (*initial)->histogram;
00926   }
00927   else
00928   {
00929     for (size_t i=1 ; i < new_initial_histogram.size()-1; i++)
00930     {
00931       double combined_bin_value = combined_min + (combined_step * (i-1));
00932       for (size_t j=1; j < new_initial_histogram.size()-1; j++)
00933       {
00934         double initial_bin_value = initial_min + (initial_step * (j-1));
00935         if ( initial_bin_value >= combined_bin_value &&
00936              initial_bin_value < combined_bin_value + combined_step)
00937         {
00938           new_initial_histogram[i] += (*initial)->histogram[j];
00939         }
00940       }
00941     }
00942   }
00943 
00944     // put the optimal quality values into the correct new bins
00945   std::vector<int> new_optimal_histogram; 
00946   new_optimal_histogram.resize((*optimal)->histogram.size(), 0);
00947   new_optimal_histogram[0] = (*optimal)->histogram[0];
00948   new_optimal_histogram[new_optimal_histogram.size()-1] = 
00949                 (*optimal)->histogram[(*optimal)->histogram.size()-1];
00950 
00951     // populate optimal histogram
00952   if (optimal_range == combined_range)
00953   {
00954       // just copy histogram
00955     new_optimal_histogram = (*optimal)->histogram;
00956   }
00957   else
00958   {
00959     for (size_t i=1 ; i < new_optimal_histogram.size()-1; i++)
00960     {
00961       double combined_bin_value = combined_min + (combined_step * (i-1));
00962       for (size_t j=1; j < new_optimal_histogram.size()-1; j++)
00963       {
00964         double optimal_bin_value = optimal_min + (optimal_step * (j-1));
00965         if (optimal_bin_value >= combined_bin_value &&
00966             optimal_bin_value < combined_bin_value + combined_step)
00967         {
00968           new_optimal_histogram[i] += (*optimal)->histogram[j];
00969         }
00970       }
00971     }
00972   }
00973 
00974     // determine largest number of values in a 'bin' for both histograms
00975   unsigned i;
00976   int max_interval_num = 1;
00977   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
00978   {
00979     if (new_initial_histogram[i] > max_interval_num)
00980       max_interval_num = new_initial_histogram[i];
00981   }
00982   for (i = 0; i < new_optimal_histogram.size(); ++i)
00983   {
00984     if (new_optimal_histogram[i] > max_interval_num)
00985       max_interval_num = new_optimal_histogram[i];
00986   }
00987 
00988     // calculate how many bar graph characters will represent the 
00989     // largest 'bin' value.
00990     // create the 'before' histogram
00991   int termwidth = get_terminal_width();
00992   const char indent[] = "   ";
00993   const char GRAPH_CHAR = '=';  // Character used to create bar graphs
00994   const int TOTAL_WIDTH = termwidth > 30 ? termwidth : 70;   // Width of histogram
00995   int GRAPHW = TOTAL_WIDTH - sizeof(indent);
00996 
00997   if (0 == max_interval_num)
00998     return; // no data 
00999   
01000     // Calculate width of field containing counts for 
01001     // histogram intervals (log10(max_interval)).
01002   int num_width = 1;
01003   for (int temp = max_interval_num; temp > 0; temp /= 10)
01004     ++num_width;
01005   GRAPHW -= num_width;
01006 
01007      // Create an array of bar graph characters for use in output
01008   std::vector<char> graph_chars(GRAPHW+1, GRAPH_CHAR);
01009   
01010     // Check if bar-graph should be linear or log10 plot
01011     // Do log plot if standard deviation is less that 1.5
01012     // histogram intervals.
01013 
01014   bool log_plot = false;
01015   double stddev = (*initial)->get_stddev();
01016   if (stddev > 0 && stddev < 2.0*combined_step)
01017   {
01018     int new_interval = (int)(log10((double)(1+max_interval_num)));
01019     if (new_interval > 0) {
01020       log_plot = true;
01021       max_interval_num = new_interval;
01022     }
01023   }
01024     // output the 'before' histogram
01025 
01026     // Write title
01027    outputStream << std::endl 
01028                 << "************** Common-scale Histograms **************" 
01029                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01030    outputStream << indent << (*initial)->get_label() << " histogram (initial mesh):";
01031   if (log_plot)
01032     outputStream << " (log10 plot)";
01033   outputStream << std::endl;
01034 
01035     // Calculate width of a single quality interval value
01036   double interval_value = 0.0;
01037   int max_interval_width = 0;
01038   std::stringstream str_stream;
01039   std::string interval_string; 
01040   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
01041   {
01042     interval_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01043     if (combined_step >= .001)
01044       interval_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(interval_value);
01045     str_stream.clear();
01046     str_stream.str(""); 
01047     interval_string = "";
01048     str_stream << interval_value;
01049     interval_string = str_stream.str();
01050     if (interval_string.length() >  (size_t)max_interval_width)
01051       max_interval_width = interval_string.length();
01052   }
01053 
01054     // adjust graph width for actual size of interval values
01055   GRAPHW = GRAPHW - (max_interval_width*2) - 5; 
01056 
01057     // For each interval of histogram
01058   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
01059   {
01060       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01061       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01062     if (0 == i)
01063     {
01064       if (0 == new_initial_histogram[i])
01065         continue;
01066       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01067     }
01068       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01069       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01070     else if (i+1 == new_initial_histogram.size())
01071     {
01072       if (0 == new_initial_histogram[i])
01073         continue;
01074       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01075     }
01076       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01077       // Print the range for each interval.
01078     else
01079     {
01080       double start_value = combined_min + (i-1)*combined_step;
01081       double end_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01082 
01083       if (combined_step >= 0.001)
01084       {
01085         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01086         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01087       }
01088 
01089       outputStream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01090                    << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01091                    << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01092     }
01093 
01094       // Print bar graph
01095     
01096       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01097     int num_graph;
01098     if (log_plot)
01099       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+new_initial_histogram[i])) / max_interval_num;
01100     else
01101       num_graph = GRAPHW * new_initial_histogram[i] / max_interval_num;
01102       
01103       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01104     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01105     outputStream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01106     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01107 
01108       // Print interval count.
01109     outputStream << new_initial_histogram[i] << std::endl;
01110   }
01111   
01112    outputStream << "  metric was evaluated " << (*initial)->count << " times." 
01113                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01114 
01115     // output the 'after' histogram
01116    outputStream << std::endl << indent << (*optimal)->get_label() << " histogram (optimal mesh):";
01117   if (log_plot)
01118     outputStream << " (log10 plot)";
01119   outputStream << std::endl;
01120 
01121     // For each interval of histogram
01122   for (i = 0; i < new_optimal_histogram.size(); ++i)
01123   {
01124       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01125       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01126     if (0 == i)
01127     {
01128       if (0 == new_optimal_histogram[i])
01129         continue;
01130       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01131     }
01132       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01133       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01134     else if (i+1 == new_optimal_histogram.size())
01135     {
01136       if (0 == new_optimal_histogram[i])
01137         continue;
01138       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01139     }
01140       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01141       // Print the range for each interval.
01142     else
01143     {
01144       double start_value = combined_min + (i-1)*combined_step;
01145       double end_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01146 
01147       if (combined_step >= 0.001)
01148       {
01149         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01150         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01151       }
01152 
01153       outputStream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01154                    << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01155                    << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01156 
01157     }
01158 
01159       // Print bar graph
01160     
01161       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01162     int num_graph;
01163     if (log_plot)
01164       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+new_optimal_histogram[i])) / max_interval_num;
01165     else
01166       num_graph = GRAPHW * new_optimal_histogram[i] / max_interval_num;
01167       
01168       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01169     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01170     outputStream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01171     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01172 
01173       // Print interval count.
01174     outputStream << new_optimal_histogram[i] << std::endl;
01175     
01176   }
01177   
01178    outputStream << "  metric was evaluated " << (*optimal)->count << " times." 
01179                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01180 
01181 
01182   return;
01183 }
01184 
01185 QualityAssessor::Assessor::Assessor( QualityMetric* metric, const char* label )
01186   : qualMetric(metric),
01187     mLabel( label ? std::string(label) : metric->get_name() ),
01188     pMean(0.0),
01189     haveHistRange(false),
01190     histMin(1.0),
01191     histMax(0.0),
01192     tagHandle(0),
01193     stoppingFunction(false),
01194     referenceCount(0),
01195     assessScheme(NO_SCHEME)
01196 {
01197   reset_data();
01198 }
01199 
01200 const QualityAssessor::Assessor* QualityAssessor::get_results( QualityMetric* metric ) const
01201 {
01202   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01203   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01204     if ((*iter)->get_metric() == metric)
01205       return *iter;
01206   return 0;
01207 }
01208 
01209 const QualityAssessor::Assessor* QualityAssessor::get_results( const char* name ) const
01210 {
01211   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01212   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01213     if ((*iter)->get_label() == name)
01214       return *iter;
01215   return 0;
01216 }
01217 
01218 
01219 void QualityAssessor::Assessor:: get_histogram( double& lower_bound_out,
01220                                                 double& upper_bound_out,
01221                                                 std::vector<int>& counts_out,
01222                                                 MsqError& err ) const 
01223 {
01224   if ( !have_histogram() )
01225   {
01226     MSQ_SETERR(err)("No histogram calculated.", MsqError::INVALID_STATE);
01227     return;
01228   }
01229 
01230   lower_bound_out = histMin;
01231   upper_bound_out = histMax;
01232   counts_out = histogram;
01233 }
01234 
01235 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::reset_data()
01236 {
01237   count = 0;
01238   sum = 0;
01239   maximum = -HUGE_VAL;
01240   minimum = HUGE_VAL;
01241   sqrSum = 0;
01242   pSum = 0;
01243   numInvalid = 0;
01244   assessScheme = NO_SCHEME;
01245     // zero histogram data
01246   size_t hist_size = histogram.size();
01247   histogram.clear();
01248   histogram.resize( hist_size, 0 );
01249 }
01250 
01251 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_value( double metric_value )
01252 {
01253   sum += metric_value;
01254   sqrSum += metric_value*metric_value;
01255   if (metric_value > maximum)
01256     maximum = metric_value;
01257   if (metric_value < minimum)
01258     minimum = metric_value;
01259     // Only add value to histogram data from this function if
01260     // the user has specified the range.  If user has not 
01261     // specified the range, QualityAssessor will call add_hist_value()
01262     // directly once the range has been calculated.
01263   if (have_histogram() && haveHistRange)
01264     add_hist_value( metric_value );
01265   
01266   if (have_power_mean())
01267     pSum += pow( metric_value, pMean );
01268   
01269   ++count;
01270 }
01271 
01272 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_invalid_value()
01273 {
01274   ++numInvalid;
01275 }
01276 
01277 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_hist_value( double metric_value )
01278 {
01279     // First and last values in array are counts of values
01280     // outside the user-specified range of the histogram
01281     // (below and above, respectively.)
01282   if (metric_value < histMin)
01283     ++histogram[0];
01284   else if (metric_value > histMax)
01285     ++histogram[histogram.size()-1];
01286   else
01287   {
01288       // Calculate which interval the value is in.  Add one
01289       // because first entry is for values below user-specifed
01290       // minimum value for histogram.
01291     double range = histMax - histMin;
01292     double fract;
01293     if (range > DBL_EPSILON)
01294       fract = (metric_value - histMin) / range;
01295     else
01296       fract = 0.0;
01297     unsigned cell;
01298     if (fabs(fract - 1.0) < histMax*DBL_EPSILON)
01299       cell = histogram.size() - 1;
01300     else
01301       cell = 1 + (int)((fract * (histogram.size()-2)));
01302 
01303       // Add value to interval.
01304     ++histogram[cell];
01305   }
01306 }
01307 
01308 
01309 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::calculate_histogram_range()
01310 {
01311   double lower_bound = minimum;
01312   int num_intervals = histogram.size();
01313   double step = (maximum - lower_bound) / num_intervals;
01314   if (step == 0)
01315     step = 1.0;
01316   double size = pow( 10.0, floor(log10(step / (num_intervals-1))) );
01317   if (size < 1e-6) 
01318     size = 1.0;
01319   histMin = lower_bound;
01320   histMax = lower_bound + num_intervals * size * ceil(step/size);
01321 }  
01322 
01323 void QualityAssessor::print_summary( std::ostream& stream ) const
01324 {
01325   const int NAMEW = 19;  // Width of name column in table output
01326   const int NUMW = 12;   // Width of value columns in table output
01327   
01328     // Print title
01329   stream << std::endl 
01330          << "************** " 
01331          << qualityAssessorName
01332          << " Summary **************"
01333          << std::endl
01334          << std::endl;
01335          
01336   if (myData->freeElementCount != myData->elementCount)
01337     stream << "  Evaluating quality for " << myData->freeElementCount 
01338            << " free elements of " << myData->elementCount 
01339            << " total elements." << std::endl;
01340   else
01341     stream << "  Evaluating quality for " << myData->elementCount 
01342            << " elements." << std::endl;
01343 
01344     // Print element type totals
01345   std::string str_value = "";
01346   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
01347   {
01348     if ( elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] )
01349     {
01350       str_value = element_name_as_string(i);
01351       if (str_value != "")
01352         stream << "  This mesh had " 
01353                << elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON]
01354                << " " << str_value << " elements." << std::endl;
01355     }
01356   }
01357   
01358   if (myData->invertedElementCount) {
01359     stream << "  THERE ARE "
01360            << myData->invertedElementCount
01361            << " INVERTED ELEMENTS. "
01362            << std::endl
01363            << "  (Elements invalid at "
01364            << myData->invertedSampleCount
01365            << " of " << myData->sampleCount
01366            << " sample locations.)"
01367            << std::endl
01368            << std::endl;
01369   }
01370   else {
01371     stream << "  There were no inverted elements detected. "
01372            << std::endl;
01373   }
01374   
01375     // Check if there are invalid values for any metric
01376   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01377   bool some_invalid = false;
01378   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
01379     if ((*iter)->get_invalid_element_count()) {
01380       some_invalid = true;
01381       stream << "  " << (*iter)->get_invalid_element_count()
01382              << " OF " << (*iter)->get_count()
01383              << " ENTITIES EVALUATED TO AN UNDEFINED VALUE FOR " 
01384              << (*iter)->get_label()
01385              << std::endl << std::endl;
01386     }
01387   }
01388   if (!some_invalid) {
01389     stream << "  No entities had undefined values for any computed metric." 
01390            << std::endl << std::endl;
01391   }
01392 
01393   if (!invalid_values)
01394   {
01395       // Check if a user-define power-mean was calculated for any of the metrics
01396     std::set<double> pmeans;
01397     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01398       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean())
01399         pmeans.insert( (*iter)->get_power() );
01400       
01401       // If power-mean of 1 or 2 was requested, change titles rather
01402       // than printing redundant values
01403     std::string average_str("average"), rms_str("rms");
01404     if (pmeans.find(1.0) != pmeans.end()) {
01405       pmeans.erase( pmeans.find(1.0) );
01406       average_str = "1-mean";
01407     }
01408     if (pmeans.find(2.0) != pmeans.end()) {
01409       pmeans.erase( pmeans.find(2.0) );
01410       rms_str = "2-mean";
01411     }
01412   
01413       // Number of values in table
01414     unsigned num_values = pmeans.size() + 5;
01415   
01416       // Decide how wide of a table field should be used for the metric name
01417     unsigned twidth = get_terminal_width();
01418     unsigned maxnwidth = NAMEW;
01419     if (twidth) {
01420       unsigned valwidth = NUMW*num_values;
01421       maxnwidth = valwidth < twidth ? twidth - valwidth : 0;
01422     }
01423     unsigned namewidth = 0;
01424     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01425       if ((*iter)->get_label().size() > namewidth)
01426         namewidth = (*iter)->get_label().size();
01427     if (namewidth > maxnwidth)
01428       namewidth = maxnwidth;
01429     if (namewidth < 7)  // at least enough width for the column header
01430       namewidth = 7;
01431 
01432     int number_of_assessments = 0;
01433 
01434       // print metric values
01435     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01436     {
01437       if (number_of_assessments > 0)
01438         stream <<"    -------------------------------------------" << std::endl;
01439      
01440         // print assessment method used to calculate the statistics
01441       if ( (*iter)->assessScheme == TMP_QUALITY_METRIC)
01442         stream << "     Sample Point Quality Statistics" 
01443                << std::endl << std::endl;
01444       else
01445         stream << "     Element Quality Statistics" 
01446                << std::endl << std::endl;
01447      
01448         // print comlumn label line
01449       std::set<double>::const_iterator piter;
01450       stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "minimum";
01451       for (piter = pmeans.begin(); piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 1.0; ++piter)
01452         stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01453       stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << average_str;
01454       for (; piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 2.0; ++piter)
01455         stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01456       stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << rms_str;
01457       for (; piter != pmeans.end(); ++piter)
01458         stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01459       stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "maximum";
01460       stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "std.dev.";
01461       stream << std::endl;
01462   
01463       stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_minimum();
01464         // print power-means with P less than 1.0
01465       for (piter = pmeans.begin(); piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 1.0; ++piter) {
01466         if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01467           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01468         else
01469           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01470       }
01471         // print average
01472       stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_average();
01473         // print power-means with P less than 2.0
01474       for ( ; piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 2.0; ++piter) {
01475         if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01476           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01477         else
01478           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01479       }
01480         // print RMS
01481       stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_rms();
01482         // print power-means with P greater than 2.0
01483       for ( ; piter != pmeans.end(); ++piter) {
01484         if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01485           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01486         else
01487           stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01488       }
01489         // print maximum and standard deviation
01490       stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_maximum();
01491       stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_stddev();
01492       stream << std::endl << std::endl;
01493 
01494       stream << "     Number of statistics = " << (*iter)->get_count() << std::endl;
01495 
01496         // print name
01497       stream << "     Metric = "  << (*iter)->get_label() << std::endl;
01498     
01499         // Output the method used to calcualte the quality values
01500       switch ( (*iter)->assessScheme )
01501       {
01502       case ELEMENT_AVG_QM:
01503         stream << "     Element Quality = average over metric values at the elements' sample points" 
01504                << std::endl << std::endl;
01505         break;
01506       case ELEMENT_MAX_QM:
01507         stream << "     Element Quality = maximum over metric values at the elements' sample points" 
01508                << std::endl << std::endl;
01509         break;
01510       case TMP_QUALITY_METRIC:
01511         stream << std::endl << std::endl;
01512         break;
01513       case QUALITY_METRIC:
01514         stream << "     Element Quality not based on sample points." 
01515                << std::endl << std::endl;
01516         break;
01517       default: 
01518         stream << "     Scheme used for deriving qualitiy values unknown" 
01519                << std::endl << std::endl;
01520       }
01521       if ((*iter)->have_histogram())
01522         (*iter)->print_histogram( stream, get_terminal_width() );
01523       number_of_assessments++;
01524     }
01525   }
01526   else
01527   {
01528     stream << "  Element Quality Statistics are Undefined for this Metric because"  << std::endl
01529            << "  there are Inverted Elements" << std::endl << std::endl;
01530 
01531   }
01532 }
01533 
01534 
01535 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::print_histogram( std::ostream& stream,
01536                                                  int termwidth ) const
01537 {
01538   // Portability notes:
01539   //  Use log10 rather than log10f because the float variations require
01540   //  including platform-dependent headers on some platforms.  
01541   //  Explicitly cast log10 argument to double because some platforms
01542   //  have overloaded float and double variations in C++ making an 
01543   //  implicit cast from an integer ambiguous.
01544   
01545   const char indent[] = "   ";
01546   const char GRAPH_CHAR = '=';  // Character used to create bar graphs
01547   const int TOTAL_WIDTH = termwidth > 30 ? termwidth : 70;   // Width of histogram
01548   int GRAPHW = TOTAL_WIDTH - sizeof(indent);
01549   
01550     // range is either user-specified (histMin & histMax) or
01551     // calculated (minimum & maximum)
01552   double min, max;
01553   min = histMin;
01554   max = histMax;
01555     // Witdh of one interval of histogram
01556   double step = (max - min) / (histogram.size()-2);
01557     // round step to 3 significant digits
01558 
01559   if (step >= 0.001)
01560     step = round_to_3_significant_digits(step);
01561   
01562     // Find maximum value for an interval bin of the histogram
01563   unsigned i;
01564   int max_bin_value = 1;
01565   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01566     if (histogram[i] > max_bin_value)
01567       max_bin_value = histogram[i];
01568   
01569   if (0 == max_bin_value)
01570     return; // no data 
01571   
01572     // Calculate width of field containing counts for 
01573     // histogram intervals (log10(max_bin_value)).
01574   int num_width = 1;
01575   for (int temp = max_bin_value; temp > 0; temp /= 10)
01576     ++num_width;
01577   GRAPHW -= num_width;
01578 
01579     // Create an array of bar graph characters for use in output
01580   std::vector<char> graph_chars(GRAPHW+1, GRAPH_CHAR);
01581   
01582     // Check if bar-graph should be linear or log10 plot
01583     // Do log plot if standard deviation is less that 1.5
01584     // histogram intervals.
01585   bool log_plot = false;
01586   double stddev = get_stddev();
01587   if (stddev > 0 && stddev < 2.0*step)
01588   {
01589     int new_interval = (int)(log10((double)(1+max_bin_value)));
01590     if (new_interval > 0) {
01591       log_plot = true;
01592       max_bin_value = new_interval;
01593     }
01594   }
01595   
01596     // Write title
01597   stream << indent << get_label() << " histogram:";
01598   if (log_plot)
01599     stream << " (log10 plot)";
01600   stream << std::endl;
01601 
01602     // Calculate width of a single quality interval value
01603 
01604   double interval_value = 0.0;
01605   int max_interval_width = 0;
01606   std::stringstream str_stream;
01607   std::string interval_string; 
01608   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01609   {
01610     interval_value = min + (i)*step;
01611     if (step >= 0.001)
01612       interval_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(interval_value);
01613     str_stream.clear();
01614     str_stream.str(""); 
01615     interval_string = "";
01616     str_stream << interval_value;
01617     interval_string = str_stream.str();
01618     if (interval_string.length() >  (size_t)max_interval_width)
01619       max_interval_width = interval_string.length();
01620   }
01621 
01622     // adjust graph width for actual size of interval values
01623   GRAPHW = GRAPHW - (max_interval_width*2) - 5; 
01624 
01625     // For each interval of histogram
01626   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01627   {
01628       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01629       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01630     if (0 == i)
01631     {
01632       if (0 == histogram[i])
01633         continue;
01634       stream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01635     }
01636       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01637       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01638     else if (i+1 == histogram.size())
01639     {
01640       if (0 == histogram[i])
01641         continue;
01642       stream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01643     }
01644       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01645       // Print the range for each interval.
01646     else
01647     {
01648       double start_value = min + (i-1)*step;
01649       double end_value = min + (i)*step;
01650       if (step >= 0.001)
01651       {
01652         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01653         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01654       }
01655 
01656       stream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01657              << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01658              << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01659 
01660         // reset stream alignment to right (the default)
01661       stream << std::right;
01662 
01663     }
01664 
01665       // Print bar graph
01666     
01667       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01668     int num_graph;
01669     if (log_plot)
01670       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+histogram[i])) / max_bin_value;
01671     else
01672       num_graph = GRAPHW * histogram[i] / max_bin_value;
01673       
01674       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01675     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01676     stream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01677     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01678 
01679       // Print interval count.
01680     stream << histogram[i] << std::endl;
01681     
01682   }
01683   stream << "  metric was evaluated " << count << " times." 
01684          << std::endl << std::endl;
01685 }
01686 
01687 #ifdef _MSC_VER
01688 # define fileno(A) _fileno( (A) )
01689 #endif 
01690 int QualityAssessor::get_terminal_width() const
01691 {
01692 #ifdef TIOCGWINSZ
01693   int fd = -1;
01694   if (&outputStream == &std::cout)
01695     fd = fileno(stdout);
01696   else if (&outputStream == &std::cerr)
01697     fd = fileno(stderr);
01698 #ifdef FSTREAM_HAS_FD
01699   else if (std::ofstream* f = dynamic_cast<std::ofstream*>(&outputStream))
01700     fd = f->rdbuf()->fd();
01701 #endif
01702 
01703   if (fd >= 0) {
01704     struct winsize ws;
01705     if (ioctl(fd, TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) >= 0)
01706       return ws.ws_col;
01707   }
01708 #endif
01709 
01710   return 0;
01711 }
01712 
01713 std::string QualityAssessor::element_name_as_string(int enum_name)
01714 {
01715   std::string str_value = "";
01716 
01717   switch (enum_name)
01718   {
01719     case POLYGON:       str_value.assign("polygon"); break;
01720     case TRIANGLE:      str_value.assign("triangle"); break;
01721     case QUADRILATERAL: str_value.assign("quadrilateral"); break;
01722     case POLYHEDRON:    str_value.assign("polyhedron"); break;
01723     case TETRAHEDRON:   str_value.assign("tetrahedron"); break;
01724     case HEXAHEDRON:    str_value.assign("hexahedron"); break;
01725     case PRISM:         str_value.assign("prism"); break;
01726     case SEPTAHEDRON:   str_value.assign("septahedron"); break;
01727     case MIXED:         str_value.assign("mixed"); break;
01728     case PYRAMID:       str_value.assign("pyramid"); break;
01729   }
01730 
01731   return str_value;
01732 }
01733 
01734 double QualityAssessor::round_to_3_significant_digits(double number)
01735 {
01736   double result = number;
01737   double p=1.0;
01738 
01739   if (number > 0 && number < 1000)
01740   {
01741     if ( number < 1000 )
01742     {
01743       while ( number <100 ) 
01744       {
01745         number *= 10;
01746         p *= 10;
01747       }
01748     }
01749     else 
01750     {
01751       while ( number >= 1000 )
01752       {
01753         number /= 10;
01754         p /= 10;
01755       }
01756     }
01757     int z = int(number + 0.5);
01758     result = z / p;
01759   }
01760 
01761   return result;
01762 }
01763 
01764 
01765 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::stopping_function_value() const
01766 {
01767   return have_power_mean() ? get_power_mean() : get_average();
01768 }
